author: asyncakash
content: how can you compute the entry queue validators count? I was thinking of doing `deposit_count - last validator_index (+1)` but it gives a value different from https://www.validatorqueue.com/

author: potuz
content: It's the list of validators that have `activation_epoch > current_epoch`. Currently you just need to find out the smallest index that satisfies this condition, and just take the length of the validator set minus that index.

author: potuz
content: if you do deposit count you will be counting validators that haven't been voted yet in the beacon chain, you would also be counting partial deposits as new validators, etc.

author: potuz
content: this is not possible to compute accurately today since it would depend on the eth1 voting period and ultimately on the dynamics of how clients implement their eth1 voting algorithm (some used to follow the majority, others imposed certain conditions)

author: potuz
content: you are counting a full eth1 data voting round but it may be less depending on when the deposit was included.
